metadata.title: CVE-2020-16044 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 88.0.4324.96 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted SCTPpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
